content: mask mates ear savers crochet pattern help save the ears of our frontline workers hi friends just a few things to know before you begin… please make sure that wherever you are planning to donate is accepting these some places are not because they cannot be sterilized and some are only accepting those made with cotton yarn for this reason i used acrylic yarn but it is just as washable as scrubs which works for my hospital other places may be different thank you for supporting our frontline workers video tutorial of this pattern can be found on youtube https //youtu be/avh5boepayy if you have questions about this pattern please don t hesitate to email me at lotusbloomscrochet@gmail com or message me on etsy from my shop lotusbloomsdesigns etsy com where you can also find many more awesome patterns if you prefer ravelry you can find me there too happy crocheting -sarah supplies needed § small amount worsted weight yarn in color of choice example is red heart super saver see note above about acrylic yarn § 2 large buttons 3/4 inch to 1 inch works best below ½ inch may not hold mask § size h/5 00 hook § needle for sewing on buttons embroidery needle works best yarn needle may work for buttons with bigger holes 1 buttons § scissors ó lotus blooms designs | all rights reserved www lotusbloomsdesigns etsy com 1 abbreviations/stitched/techniques used pattern is in u s terms there are many tutorials on youtube for any stitch you are not sure about § chain chain § fasten_off chain 1 pull loop out pull tight § half_double_crochet half_double_crochet § single_crochet single_crochet § slip_stitch slip_stitch § slip knot § st sts stitch stiches § these will appear at the end of the row/round to tell you how many stitches you should have when you finish that row/round finished size gauge and when finished ear savers measure about 5 inches long other patterns are longer or shorter and they work but this is the size i ve found works best i am not including a specific gauge for this pattern as it is okay if it is not exact i tend to crochet tight so yours might be slightly longer than mine or you may be even tighter than me shoot for 5 inches if it s way too long you can remove chains at the beginning if it s too short you can add after you get the hang of the pattern just make sure increases of round 2 are always on the end 3 sts it s small and works up fast so it s easy to adjust if needed base pattern make slip knot leaving long roughly 10 inch tail at beginning do not weave or crochet this in with h/5 00mm hook chain 13 round 1 2 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 1 half_double_crochet in each remaining chain across place 4 additional half_double_crochet in end chain 5 total turn 180 degress do not
